div.span: Sales In-Charge:
CREDIT COLLECTION AGREEMENT
DATED
BETWEEN
INFO CAPITAL PTE LTD
THIS AGREEMENT
is made on
BETWEEN:
INFO CAPITAL PTE LTD
And
, a company / individual in Singapore and having its registered office and place of business / residential at , , -, . (hereinafter called “CLIENT”).
WHEREAS:
A. IFC is in the business of Credit Collection and Credit Management.
B. CLIENT is in the business of (if CLIENT is an individual, indicate “NIL”)
C. CLIENT wishes to engage the services of IFC for Credit Collection and Credit Management (each term as defined below) upon and subject to the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement.
D. IFC and CLIENT are collectively known as Parties.
NOW IT IS HEREBY AGREED AS FOLLOWS:
1. DEFINITIONS
Account” refers to the credit facilities granted by the CLIENT to their customers pursuant to an instalment or other agreement;
1.2 “Commencement Date” means the date on which this Agreement shall commence as set out in Clause 2 or such date as the parties may agree;
1.3 “Credit Collection” refers to debt collection activities on assigned Accounts;
1.4 “Credit Management” refers to the investigation of the current status of an assigned Account.
1.5 “Debtor” refers to CLIENT’S customer who is the owing party
1.6 “Term” means the duration of this Agreement as stated under Clause 2;
1.7 “Validity” refers to the lifespan of each Account upon receiving;
1.8 “Commission Fees” refers to payment entitled to IFC;
1.9 “Collected Sums” refers to monies collected from each Account;
“Payment Terms” refers to the payment terms and mode between IFC and CLIENT;
“Instalment Terms” refers to time taken by each Accounts to clear the credit given;
1.12 “Instalment Agreement” refers to an agreement enter into by each Account to fulfil their credit
liability;
1.13 “Subscription Fees” refers to the fees payable by CLIENT upon engaging IFC’s services.
1.14 “PDPA” Singapore Personal Data Protection Act 2012;
1.15 “Personal Data” As its definition under PDPA.
APPOINTMENT & SUBSCRIPTION FEES
2.1 CLIENT hereby appoints IFC for Credit Collection and Credit Management. IFC hereby accepts the appointment, upon and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
This appointment shall commence on and continue for a term of
months therefrom unless terminated in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement.
2.2 The CLIENT agrees to subscribe IFC’s services for
2.3 All Subscription Fees, if any, are non-refundable and non-inclusive of Commission Fees.
ENTITLEMENT
3.1 CLIENT is entitled to handover
one (1)
Accounts to IFC during the Term. The CLIENT will do
as deem fit on the number of Accounts and value of each Accounts during the Term.
3.2 IFC is entitled to include administrative, visitation and miscellaneous fees to each
Account(s).
3.3 IFC is entitled at its own discretion, negotiate any Instalment Agreement amount at
CLIENTS’ interest, in view of Debtors’ financial status.
VALIDITY
Upon receiving each Account, each Account has a validity of minimum
three (3
) Months before expiry on Unworkable Accounts.
COMMISSION FEES
5.1 Upon successful Debt Collection on each Account, in full or in part, DAA will be entitled to 30%
commission.
5.2 Any payment in kind in term or Credit Note or Waiver or merchandises accepted by CLIENT in lieu of debts are deemed to be direct and/or partial settlement on the Account. IFC will beentitled to
commission of the same value.
PAYMENT TERMS

6.1 IFC will accumulate all Collected Sums within one (1) month and release such payment to CLIENT within thirty (30) days. IFC shall not withhold any Collected Sums due to CLIENT without valid reasons.

6.2 CLIENT may accumulate all Collected Sums within one (1) month that it received and release Commission Fees to IFC within thirty (30) days. CLIENT shall not withhold any Commission Fees due to IFC without valid reasons.
6.3 IFC reserves the right to deduct its commission directly from any monies collected from the Debtor or to withhold monies or cheques collected from Debtor if its invoices are not paid on time.
6.4 All Collected Sums due to CLIENT shall be issue to “”
UNDERTAKING
IFC undertakes
during the Term that it will:
a. ensure that no methods or tactics used or proposed to be used in providing services under this Agreement shall be repugnant to any applicable laws, guidelines and regulations;

b. represent itself or hold itself out as the appointed Credit Collection Agent however have no right or authority to create or confer any obligation of any kind in CLIENT’s name or on CLIENT’s behalf.
c. Maintain professional field team;
d. Act on each Account by phone, place of residence or any place of interests;
e. Maintain communication with CLIENT and provided any necessary assistances and advices where possible;
f. Maintained preferred payment mode and anti-bribery on each Account;
g. Enforce due diligence on each Account to ensure actions are taken within reasonable timeframe;

i. Ensure all information, documents and other materials relating to or obtained as a result of this Agreement, in particular but without limitation on the Accounts’ information are strictly private and confidential.
CLIENT undertakes
during the Term that it will:
a. Not withdraw any Accounts given and/or allocated to IFC during the Term; otherwise full commission is chargeable on the unpaid balance;
b. Not withdraw any Accounts under Instalment Agreement as Instalment Terms may be beyond the Term of this Agreement;
c. Provide all documents and ensure the legality of all documents;

e. Agrees that with regard to each account accepted for collection, IFC may either make the collection itself directly or forward, on behalf of the CLIENT, the account accepted for collection to a firm of solicitors or other third-party agents, who shall accordingly be deemed to be the CLIENT solicitors or agents.

f. In the event that the CLIENT does not designate the solicitors or third-party agent to whom any particular account or accounts shall be forwarded to, IFC shall be authorised, as the CLIENT agent, to appoint a solicitor or third-party agent and forward such accounts to the solicitor or third-party agent for collection.
8. TERMINATION & CLAIMS
8.1 This Agreement may be terminated by either party giving two (2) calendar month’s prior written notice to the other.
8.2 CLIENT will be liable for any losses incurred by IFC due to unauthorize withdrawal of Accounts and Instalment Agreement which includes withholding any entitled Commission Fees.
8.3 IFC will be liable for any losses incurred by CLIENT due to unauthorize withdrawal of Accounts which includes withholding any Collected Sums.
9. DISCLAIMER
9.1 IFC do not guarantee 100% recovery of any Accounts and CLIENT shall not hold IFC responsible for any shortfall of each Account.
10. CONFIDENTIALITY
10.1 Each party shall, in respect of the Personal Data for which it is the recipient:
keep the Personal Data strictly confidential and not disclose any part of it to any person apart from its employees who require it to perform the recipient’s obligations under this Agreement;
(ii)
its auditors and professional advisors solely for the purposes of providing professional advice;
(iii)
its agents and sub-contractors involved in performing of that recipients under this Agreement, and its group companies.
11. RENEWAL
11.1 IFC’s appointment under this Agreement will be auto-renewed upon expiry unless otherwise stated or another agreement has been entered which supersedes the current agreement.
12. ANTI-BRIBERY CLAUSE
12.1 IFC has a duty to ensure that any employees given access to any information in connection with the Accounts provided by CLIENT, must comply with any applicable bribery laws.
12.2 Without prejudice to Clause 11, IFC, if found to have perform its due diligence on anti-bribery laws, shall not be held responsible if any of its employees have proven to commit such acts.
13. LIMITATION ON LIABILITY

13.1 Neither party shall be liable to the other (whether in contract, negligence, for breach of statutory duty or under Indemnity or otherwise and not withstanding any notice of the possibility of such loss for:
i)
Any indirect or consequential loss;
ii)
Pure economic loss including loss of profits; loss of earning; loss of business or goodwill; or
iii)
Anticipated or incidental losses; including loss of anticipated savings; increase in bad debt; failure to reduce bad debt.
13.2 Neither party excludes or limits its liability to the other for:
i)
Personal or death resulting from its or its employees, agents and/or sub-contractors’ negligence;
ii)
For breach of confidentiality;
iii)
For any matter which it would be illegal for that party to exclude and/or limit;
iv)
For that party’s wilful default, fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.
14. GOVERNING LAW

14.1 This Agreement and all matters arising out of or in connection with it shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the Republic of Singapore and submitted to exclusive jurisdiction of Singapore courts.

14.2 This Agreement sets out all the terms agreed between the parties relating to the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes any previous agreement between the parties relating to the same subject matters. Neither of the parties shall be bound by, or liable to other party for, any representation, promise or inducement (other than fraudulent misrepresentations) made by it or by any agent or person on its behalf which is not expressly contained in this Agreement.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties hereto have executed this Agreement on the day and year first above-written.
SIGNED
by for and on behalf of “
IFC
INFO CAPITAL PTE LTD
DATE:
*Sign with company stamp
SIGNED
by for and on behalf of the “
CLIENT
DATE:
*Sign with company stamp
Sales In-Charge:

THIS AGREEMENT

BETWEEN:
INFO CAPITAL PTE LTD
, a company incorporated in Singapore and having its registered office and place of business at 51 Bukit Batok Crescent, Unity Centre, #01-01, Singapore 520131 (hereinafter called “IFC”);
And
, a company incorporated in Singapore and having its previous registered office and place of business at , , -, (hereinafter called “CLIENT”).
WHEREAS:
A. IFC is in the business of Credit Collection and Credit Management.
B. CLIENT is in the business of . (Indicate “Nil” if the Client is an individual)
C. CLIENT wishes to engage the services of IFC for Credit Collection and Credit Management (each term as defined below) upon and subject to the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement.
D. IFC and CLIENT are collectively known as Parties.
NOW IT IS HEREBY AGREED AS FOLLOWS:
1. DEFINITIONS
Account” refers to the credit facilities granted by the CLIENT to their customers pursuant to an instalment or other agreement;
1.2 “Commencement Date” means the date on which this Agreement shall commence as set out in Clause 2 or such date as the parties may agree;
1.3 “Credit Collection” refers to Credit collection activities on assigned Accounts;
1.4 “Credit Management” refers to the Account Receivables Management of the current status of an assigned Account.
1.5 “Debtor” refers to CLIENT’S customer who is the owing party
1.6 “Term” means the duration of this Agreement as stated under Clause 2;
1.7 “Validity” refers to the lifespan of each Account upon receiving;
1.8 “Commission Fees” refers to payment entitled to IFC;
1.9 “Collected Sums” refers to monies collected from each Account;
“Payment Terms” refers to the payment terms and mode between IFC and CLIENT;
“Instalment Terms” refers to time taken by each Accounts to clear the credit given;
1.12 “Instalment Agreement” refers to an agreement enter into by each Account to fulfil their credit liability;
1.13 “Subscription Fees” refers to the fees payable by CLIENT upon engaging IFC’s services.
1.14 “PDPA” Singapore Personal Data Protection Act 2012;
1.15 “Personal Data” As its definition under PDPA.
APPOINTMENT & SUBSCRIPTION FEES

2.1 CLIENT hereby appoints IFC for Credit Management. IFC hereby accepts the appointment, upon and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. This appointment shall commence on and continue for a term of
months therefrom unless terminated in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement.
2.2 The CLIENT agrees to subscribe to IFC services for
/ month
2.3 All Subscription Fees are non-refundable.
ENTITLEMENT
3.1 CLIENT is entitled to handover up to
Twenty (20)
Accounts to IFC during the Term. CLIENT will do as deem fit on the number of Accounts and value of each Accounts during the Term.
3.2 IFC is entitled at its own discretion to perform emails, invoicing and tele calls.
COMMISSION FEES (For Credit Collection)
4.1 Upon successful Credit Collection on each Account, in full or in part, IFC will be entitled to 30
commission.
4.2 Any payment in kind in term or Credit Note or Waiver or merchandises accepted by CLIENT in lieu of debts are deemed to be direct and/or partial settlement on the Account. IFC will be entitled to
commission of the same value.
PAYMENT TERMS
5.1 All payments made shall go direct to the CLIENT.
5.2 IFC is
NOT
authorised to receive any payment on behalf of the CLIENT.
5.3 IFC shall invoice the CLIENT once a month or yearly for the subscription fees.
UNDERTAKING
IFC undertakes
during the Term that it will:
a. ensure that no methods or tactics used or proposed to be used in providing services under this Agreement shall be repugnant to any applicable laws, guidelines and regulations;

b. represent itself or hold itself out as the appointed Credit Management Agent however have no right or authority to create or confer any obligation of any kind in CLIENT’s name or on CLIENT’s behalf.
c. Maintain professional field team;
d. Act on each Account by phone, place of residence or any place of interests;
e. Maintain communication with CLIENT and provided any necessary assistances and advices where possible;
f.
Maintained preferred payment mode and anti-bribery on each Account;
g. Enforce due diligence on each Account to ensure actions are taken within reasonable timeframe;
i.

Ensure all information, documents and other materials relating to or obtained as a result of this Agreement, in particular but without limitation on the Accounts’ information are strictly private and confidential.
CLIENT undertakes
during the Term that it will:
a. Not withdraw any Accounts given and/or allocated to IFC during the Term; otherwise full commission is chargeable on the unpaid balance;
b. Not withdraw any Accounts under Instalment Agreement as Instalment Terms may be beyond the Term of this Agreement;
c. Provide all documents and ensure the legality of all documents;

e. Agrees that with regard to each account accepted for collection, IFC may ONLY make the collection itself directly and shall not forward to any third parties for the same services unless prior approve by CLIENT in writing.
f.
IFC shall not designate the solicitors or third-party agent to make collection of any account forwarded to IFC.
TERMINATION & CLAIMS
7.1 This Agreement may be terminated by either party giving two (2) calendar month’s prior written notice to the other.
7.2 CLIENT will be liable for any losses incurred by IFC due to unauthorize withdrawal of Accounts and Instalment Agreement which includes withholding any entitled Commission Fees.
7.3 IFC will be liable for any losses incurred by CLIENT due to unauthorize withdrawal of Accounts which includes withholding any Collected Sums.
8. DISCLAIMER
8.1 IFC do not guarantee 100% recovery of any Accounts and CLIENT shall not hold IFC responsible for any shortfall of each Account.
9. CONFIDENTIALITY
9.1 Each party shall, in respect of the Personal Data for which it is the recipient:
keep the Personal Data strictly confidential and not disclose any part of it to any person apart from its employees who require it to perform the recipient’s obligations under this Agreement;
(ii)
its auditors and professional advisors solely for the purposes of providing professional advice;
(iii)
its agents and sub-contractors involved in performing of that recipients under this Agreement, and its group companies.
10. RENEWAL
10.1 IFC’s appointment under this Agreement will be auto-renewed upon expiry unless otherwise stated or another agreement has been entered which supersedes the current agreement.
11. ANTI-BRIBERY CLAUSE
11.1 IFC has a duty to ensure that any employees given access to any information in connection with the Accounts provided by CLIENT, must comply with any applicable bribery laws.
11.2 Without prejudice to Clause 11, IFC, if found to have perform its due diligence on anti-bribery laws, shall not be held responsible if any of its employees have proven to commit such acts.
12. LIMITATION ON LIABILITY

12.1 Neither party shall be liable to the other (whether in contract, negligence, for breach of statutory duty or under Indemnity or otherwise and not withstanding any notice of the possibility of such loss for:
i)
Any indirect consequential loss
ii)
Pure economic loss including loss of profits; loss of earning; loss of business or goodwill; or
iii)
Anticipated or incidental losses; including loss of anticipated savings; increase in bad debt; failure to reduce bad debt.
12.2 Neither party excludes or limits its liability to the other for:
i)
Personal or death resulting from its or its employees, agents and/or sub-contractors’ negligence;
ii)
For breach of confidentiality;
iii)
For any matter which it would be illegal for that party to exclude and/or limit
iv)
For that party’s wilful default, fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.
13. GOVERNING LAW

13.1 This Agreement and all matters arising out of or in connection with it shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the Republic of Singapore and submitted to exclusive jurisdiction of Singapore courts.
13.2 This Agreement sets out all the terms agreed between the parties relating to the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes any previous agreement between the parties relating

to the same subject matters. Neither of the parties shall be bound by, or liable to other party for, any representation, promise or inducement (other than fraudulent misrepresentations) made by it or by any agent or person on its behalf which is not expressly contained in this Agreement. IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties hereto have executed this Agreement on the day and year first above-written.
